did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Hobart was a Connecticut native living in Atlanta, Georgia. The collection consists of twelve letters he wrote to a friend in Connecticut, mentioning freed slaves holding office in Georgia, the heat, and his homesickness.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Albert Hobart, Jr., Correspondence, Ms1989-081, Special Collections, University Libraries, Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Albert Hobart, Jr. Correspondence was purchased by Special Collections in 1989.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Albert Hobart, Jr., was a native of Abington, Connecticut living in Atlanta, Georgia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of twelve letters written in 1869-1870 to Hobart's "Friend Wallace" in Connecticut mentioning freed slaves holding office in Georgia, the heat, and his own homesickness.
